question: A garden has 180 flowers: 1/3 roses, 1/4 tulips, and the rest daisies. How many daisies?
A student has $50. She buys a book for $18 and pens costing $2 each. How many pens can she buy?
A team scores 3 touchdowns (7 points each) and 4 field goals (3 points each). How many total points?
A teacher assigns 120 pages to read. A student reads 15 pages per day for 4 days, then 20 pages per day. How many total days to finish?
A family spends 35% of income on rent and 15% on utilities. If these total $1200, what is their income?
A car decreases value by 30% year 1 and 20% year 2. If new value is $5600, what was original price?
A store sells pens at 5 for $3. If a teacher buys 45 pens, how much does she pay?
A jogger runs 8 km at 10 km/h and then 6 km at 6 km/h. What is the average speed?
A class of 36 students has 2/3 attending a field trip. Of those, 1/4 forget permission slips. How many attend the trip?
A warehouse stores 900 boxes. Each shelf holds 36. If the warehouse has 18 shelves, how many boxes exceed capacity?
A farmer buys 32 kg of feed. His animals eat 3/8 of it weekly. How many weeks until it is gone?
A book costs $12. It is discounted 20%, then taxed 10%. What is the final price?
A swimming pool fills at 50 L/min for 12 minutes, then 30 L/min for 20 minutes. How many liters added?
A team wins 24 of its games, which is 60% of all games. How many games did they play?
A chef prepares 360 cookies. He sells 55% and gives 1/5 of the remainder to staff. How many cookies are left?
A jar has 90 candies: 2/9 are lemon, 1/3 are cherry, and the rest are grape. How many grape candies?
A shipment contains 420 items. 3/7 are electronics, 1/5 of the electronics are defective. How many defective items?
A tank drains at 20 L/min for 8 minutes, then 15 L/min for 6 minutes. How many liters drained?
A car travels 160 miles at 40 mph and returns at 80 mph. What is the average speed?
A student scores 70, 85, 90. What must she score next to average 84?
A bakery sells 3/8 of its 320 loaves in the morning and 1/3 of the remainder in evening. How many loaves sold total?
A garden is 12 m by 18 m. A path 1 m wide is built around inside. What is path area?
A family saves 15% of income and spends $2380. If savings are $420, what is total income?
A store discounts a $150 coat by 30%. Next week it increases the discounted price by 20%. What is new price?
A team plays 60 games, wins 40%, and draws 1/3 of the wins. How many games did they draw?
A teacher buys 8 packs of markers, each with 15 markers. She gives 2/3 to students. How many markers remain?
A shop sells cups 4 for $9. How much for 18 cups?
A rope is cut in ratio 5:3. Total length is 64 m. What is shorter piece?
A car consumes 8 gallons for 120 miles. How many gallons for 330 miles?
A store has 500 phones. 30% are sold, 1/5 of remainder defective. How many working phones left?
A field is 30 m by 20 m. 25% used for corn, 40% of remainder for beans. How many m² for beans?
A shop sells pens at $1.20 each or 10 for $10. If a customer buys 27 pens, what is the minimum cost?
Sophie read 40 pages on Monday, 25% more on Tuesday, and 30% less on Wednesday than Tuesday. How many pages did she read in total?
A farmer has 360 chickens. He sells 1/3 of them, then 1/4 of the remainder die. How many chickens remain?
A store purchases items for $12 each and sells them for 40% profit. If the store sells 70 items, what is the total profit?
A water tank contains 450 liters when it is 3/5 full. How many liters are needed to fill it completely?
A bike rider travels 15 miles at 10 mph and then 12 miles at 6 mph. What is his average speed for the entire trip?
A pack of 24 markers costs $9.60. How much do 18 markers cost at the same rate?
A store increases the price of a $50 item by 30%. After poor sales, it discounts the new price by 20%. What is the final price?
A gardener plants flowers in the ratio 3 roses : 4 tulips : 5 daisies. If she plants 96 flowers, how many are daisies?
A farmer harvested 960 oranges. He sells 45% and uses 1/4 of the remainder for juice. How many oranges are left?
A recipe uses 2 cups of sugar for every 5 cups of flour. If a baker uses 20 cups of flour, how much sugar does he need?
After a 20% discount, a jacket costs $72. What was its original price?
A class has 36 students. 1/3 join math club, and 1/2 of those also join science club. How many join both clubs?
A machine produces 180 parts per hour for 4 hours, then 220 parts per hour for 3 hours. How many parts are produced in total?
A runner completes 3 laps of 800 meters and 4 laps of 400 meters. What is the total distance in kilometers?
A store buys pens for $0.50 each and sells them for $1.20. If it sells 150 pens, how much profit does it make?
A family spends 25% of income on food and $900 on rent, which is 30% of income. What is their income?
A student solves 75% of 160 practice problems. If he gets 20% of them wrong, how many does he solve correctly?
A train travels 120 miles at 60 mph, then 180 miles at 90 mph. What is the total travel time?
A library has 600 books. 1/5 are reference books, and 30% of the rest are fiction. How many fiction books are there?
A store discounts a $200 TV by 35%, then applies a coupon for $10 off. What is the final price?
A car has a fuel efficiency of 30 miles per gallon. How many gallons are needed for a 420-mile trip?
A teacher has 72 stickers. She gives 5 to each student. If she has 7 stickers left, how many students are there?
A theater has 320 seats. On opening night, 75% are filled. If 1/10 of those filled seats are VIP seats, how many VIP seats are there?
A pool drains at 18 liters per minute for 15 minutes, then 12 liters per minute for 10 minutes. How much water drains in total?
A contractor builds 240 meters of road in 4 days. Each day he builds the same amount. How many meters per day does he build?
A $500 phone is discounted 40%, then the discounted price is increased by 25%. What is the final price?
A library has 48 fiction books for every 32 nonfiction books. If there are 240 nonfiction books, how many fiction books are there?
A worker completes 35 tasks per hour for 5 hours, then 28 tasks per hour for 3 hours. How many tasks does he complete?
A jar contains red, blue, and yellow marbles in the ratio 2:3:5. If there are 180 marbles, how many are blue?
A cyclist rides 24 miles at 12 mph, then 18 miles at 9 mph. What is his average speed?
A store sells a pair of shoes for $60 after a 20% discount. What was the original price?
A bus has 56 seats. If 75% are taken and 1/3 of the empty seats are reserved, how many seats remain available?
A farmer buys a 50-pound sack of feed. His animals eat 2/5 of it weekly. How many pounds remain after 2 weeks?
A student receives grades of 84, 88, and 92. What must he score on his fourth test to average 90?
A shop sells boxes of 18 oranges. If a restaurant needs 430 oranges, how many boxes must they buy?
A class of 30 students has 40% boys. If 1/3 of the girls play soccer, how many girls play soccer?
A garden is 14 meters by 18 meters. A walkway 1 meter wide is built around the inside. What is the area of the walkway?
A company makes 20% profit on a product that costs $45 to produce. What is the selling price?
A rope is 72 meters long. It is cut so that one piece is 3/5 of the total length. How long is the shorter piece?
A bag has 90 candies: 1/3 are lemon, 2/9 are cherry, and the rest are mint. How many are mint?
A store sells staplers for $6 each or 3 for $15. If a customer buys 9 staplers using the cheapest combination, how much does he pay?
A hiking trail is 15 km long. A hiker completes 2/5 of it before lunch and 1/2 of the remainder after lunch. How many kilometers remain?
A train travels 200 miles at 80 mph, then 150 miles at 60 mph. What is the average speed for the trip?
A store buys pencils in packs of 12. They need at least 430 pencils. What is the minimum number of packs required?
A farmer divides his land so that 2/3 is for crops and 1/4 of the crop land is for wheat. If the wheat section is 30 acres, how large is the entire farm?
A shop sells shirts for $18 after a 25% discount. What was the original price?
A student solves 90% of 200 math problems but gets 10% of those wrong. How many correct answers does he have?
A cat eats 1/6 of a bag of food daily. How many bags are needed for 30 days?
A baker uses 3/4 cup of sugar per batch. If she has 15 cups, how many batches can she make?
A train leaves City A at 90 mph. One hour later, another train leaves City B at 110 mph toward City A. If the cities are 450 miles apart, how long until they meet?
A teacher assigns 240 pages. A student reads 20 pages/day for 6 days, then 30 pages/day. How many days total?
A store discounts a $120 coat by 30%, then applies 10% tax. What is the final price?
A library has 540 books. 1/5 are nonfiction, and 30% of the nonfiction books are history. How many history books are there?
A store sells apples 5 for $4. How much for 22 apples?
A baker prepares 720 cookies. He sells 50% and gives 15% of the remainder to friends. How many remain?
A school has 480 students. 30% join sports, and 40% of those join both sports and band. How many join both?
A car depreciates 20% in year 1 and 15% in year 2. If it's now worth $6120, what was the original value?
A factory produces 360 items per hour for 6 hours, then 420 per hour for 3 hours. How many items?
A container holds 48 liters when 3/8 full. How much when full?
A student increases study time from 2 hours/day to 2.5 hours/day. What percent increase?
A gardener plants trees in rows of 18. If she plants 612 trees, how many rows?
A store marks up a $50 item by 40%, then discounts by 30%. What is the final price?
A man saves $240 monthly, which is 20% of his income. What is his income?
A pool fills 60 L/min for 12 minutes, then 40 L/min for 15 minutes. How much water is added?
A school bus has 48 seats. 75% filled. If 1/8 of filled seats are teachers, how many teachers?
A hiker walks 12 km at 4 km/h and 6 km at 3 km/h. What is the average speed?
A store sells notebooks for $3 each or 4 for $10. If a teacher buys 14, what's the minimum cost?
A baker uses 2/5 of her flour and then 1/3 of the remainder. If 18 kg remain, how much flour initially?
A tank holds 900 liters. After draining 35% and refilling 150 liters, how many liters are inside?
A rope is cut in ratio 3:4:5. If the longest piece is 30 m, what is the total length?
A student solves 70% of 150 problems. If he gets 20% of those wrong, how many correct?
A store sells 15 pencils at $0.60 each or 20 for $10. If someone buys 40, what is minimum cost?
A rectangle is 18 m long and 12 m wide. A walkway 1 m wide is built around inside. What is walkway area?
A car travels 90 miles at 30 mph, then 90 miles at 45 mph. What is average speed?
A library has 300 fiction books and 200 nonfiction. Fiction increases by 20%, nonfiction by 10%. How many books now?
A factory produces 500 items daily. It increases production by 30% for a week. How many items produced that week?
A radio costs $80. It goes on sale for 25% off, then clearance for 20% off the sale price. What is final price?
A student jogs 9 miles at 6 mph and 3 miles at 4 mph. What is his average speed?
A bottle has 30 mL of medicine, which is 3/10 of full capacity. How many mL when full?
A class has 45 students. 1/3 take French, 2/5 take Spanish, and 1/6 take both. How many take only Spanish?
A machine produces 240 items/hour for 5 hours, then 300 items/hour for 4 hours. How many items produced?
A chef buys 24 kg of rice. She uses 3/8 for one dish and 1/4 of the remainder for another. How much rice left?
A store's revenue increases from $18,000 to $22,500. What percent increase?
A bakery sells 3/5 of its 450 pastries in the morning and 1/4 of the remainder in the afternoon. How many pastries remain unsold?
A factory produces 320 units per day for 6 days, then increases production by 25% for the next 4 days. How many units are produced in total?
A train travels 180 miles at 60 mph and then 210 miles at 70 mph. What is the total time for the trip?
A class has 30 students. 40% take art and 1/3 take music. If 5 students take both, how many take only music?
A bookstore marks up books by 30% on a cost of $12 per book. If a coupon gives 15% off the sale price, what is the final price?
A runner completes 5 miles at 8 mph and 7 miles at 7 mph. What is his average speed?
A school has 540 lockers. 2/3 are used by students, and 1/5 of the used lockers need repairs. How many lockers need repairs?
A grocery store sells apples at 4 for $3.75. How much would 28 apples cost?
After losing 20% of its weight, a package weighs 48 grams. What was its original weight?
A carpenter cuts a 96-inch board into pieces in the ratio 3:5:4. How long is the shortest piece?
A water tank drains at 14 liters/min for 12 minutes, then at 10 liters/min for 15 minutes. How many liters drain in total?
A machine produces 150 items/hour for 7 hours and then increases speed by 40% for 5 more hours. How many items does it produce?
A student correctly answers 80% of 150 questions. If she improves her accuracy by 10 percentage points on another 120 questions, how many total correct answers does she have?
A farmer divides his 420-acre farm so that 2/7 is corn and 3/5 of the remaining land is wheat. How many acres are wheat?
A cyclist rides 16 miles at 8 mph, takes a break, then rides 24 miles at 12 mph. What is his average speed?
A bag contains red, blue, and green marbles in ratio 7:4:5. If there are 64 marbles total, how many are green?
A movie theater sells tickets for $12 adults and $8 children. If 180 tickets were sold and the total revenue was $1740, how many adult tickets were sold?
A hiker travels 10 km at 4 km/h and 6 km at 3 km/h. How long does the entire trip take?
A bottle is filled to 3/8 of its capacity with 45 mL of liquid. What is its full capacity?
A student earns 84, 92, 78, and 86 on four tests. What score must he earn on a fifth test to average 85?
A store buys 200 calculators at $15 each and sells them at a 40% markup. If 150 are sold, what is the revenue?
A pool fills at 25 liters/min for 16 minutes and 40 liters/min for 12 minutes. How much water is in the pool?
A train leaves City A at 70 mph. One hour later, another train leaves City B at 90 mph toward City A. If the cities are 380 miles apart, how long until they meet?

A store discounts a $90 jacket by 35%, then applies 10% tax. What is the final price?
A gardener plants flowers in rows of 18. If she plants 774 flowers, how many rows are there?
A baker uses 2/5 of his flour and then 1/3 of what remains. If 36 kg are left, how much flour did he have originally?
A shipment contains 900 boxes. 40% are large boxes, and 1/6 of the large boxes are damaged. How many damaged boxes?
A bike originally costs $240. It's discounted by 25% and then by another 10%. What is the final price?
A restaurant sells combo meals for $8 each and drinks for $2 each. If 220 items were sold and total revenue was $1240, how many combo meals were sold?
A warehouse stores 2400 boxes on shelves that hold 48 each. How many shelves are needed?
A runner jogs 4 miles at 6 mph and 6 miles at 10 mph. What is his average speed?
A zoo has lions and tigers in ratio 2:3. If there are 45 tigers, how many lions?
A store buys mugs for $4 each and sells them for $6.50. If 180 mugs are sold, what is the total profit?
A school cafeteria prepares 560 meals. 3/8 are vegetarian and 1/5 of the vegetarian meals are gluten-free. How many gluten-free meals?
A container has 180 liters, which is 3/4 of its capacity. How many liters when full?
A class of 32 has 3/8 boys. If 1/4 of the boys play basketball, how many boys play?
A shop sells bananas at 3 lbs for $2.40. How much does 7.5 lbs cost?
A car travels 150 miles at 75 mph, then 180 miles at 60 mph. What is the average speed?
A farmer plants corn, wheat, and oats in ratio 6:5:4. If 300 acres are planted, how many acres of wheat?
A baker sells cupcakes for $3 each or 4 for $10. If she sells 52 cupcakes, what is the maximum revenue she can make?
A tank drains 35% of its 900 liters, then is refilled with 180 liters. How much water is in the tank?

A student reads 18 pages/day for 10 days, then 25 pages/day for 6 days. How many pages total?

A box contains 132 chocolates: 1/3 dark, 1/4 milk, and the rest white. How many white chocolates?

A hiker completes 16 miles: 6 at 4 mph, 10 at 2 mph. Total time?

A store marks up items from $25 to $40. What percent markup is this?

A car uses 10 gallons to travel 270 miles. How many gallons are needed for 405 miles?
